 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.

If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

ALLEGATION: Shelter residents placed in detention upon return from AWOL
INVESTIGATION:
I reviewed facility email dated 10/19/2020. It summarizes the phone call between
this writer and Facility Manager 1 dated the same date. It states two female neglect
wards placed in the facility’s shelter licensed program AWOL’d at approximately
08:40pm the evening of 10/16/2020. Police were contacted and Resident’s A and B
were brought back to the facility at approximately 11:00pm the same evening.
Resident A and B were very nonchalant and did not give any answers for why they
ran. Resident A continued to state, “I don’t want to be here” and began dancing,
whereas Resident B laughing at everything supervisors said. Resident’s A and B
were defiant and did not agree to make a commitment to not truant from the
program. Facility Manager 2 was contacted, and it was determined that Residents A
and B would sleep in the separately licensed detention program for the night due to
concerns for their safety and possibility of truanting again. It was determined that
Residents A and B would quarantine and be assessed in the morning to be
transitioned back into their originally placed and separately licensed shelter program.
Residents A and B entered the detention program at approximately 11:45pm and
returned to the shelter program at 09:15am.
I reviewed the State of Michigan Child Caring Institute database system. It states
the following licensing terms:
CE630201059 is licensed for short-term and treatment residents,
2

without behavior management rooms. This license is noted
as being the facility’s shelter placement program.
CE630201058 is licensed for short-term, with behavior management
rooms. This license is noted as being the facility’s secure
detention program.
It is noted that the referral for this special investigation was self-reported by the
facility.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement.
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents'
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
ANALYSIS: Resident’s A and B were initially placed in the facility’s licensed
shelter program for non-adjudicated youth. Resident’s A and B
were consequently housed in the facility’s separately licensed
secure delinquent program for adjudicated youth for 9 ½ hours,
upon their return from AWOL, due to risk from further truancy.
Such placement is not consistent with its policies and
procedures pertaining to its admissions and care given the
residents required level of care at time of referral.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
